question: Can mogamulizumab be used for the treatment of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma?
ideal_answer: Yes, mogamulizumab can be used for the treatment of cutaneous T-cell lymphoma.

snippets.text: In the large international phase III MAVORIC trial, patients with previously treated cutaneous T-cell lymphoma who received the anti-CCR4 monoclonal antibody mogamulizumab experienced significantly longer progression-free survival and higher response rates, as well as better quality of life, than those who received vorinostat, a standard therapy.
